summary: This document appears to be a letter of authorization related to tax records, involving multiple parties including Alan Blecher and Ghislaine Maxwell. It discusses the process for obtaining duplicate tax records and mentions the rights of the parties involved in relation to the accounts.

persons.name: Alan Blecher
persons.context: Alan Blecher is mentioned as an interested party in the context of receiving tax records.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell is referenced in relation to the authorization for tax records.

connections.description: Both individuals are mentioned in the context of being interested parties for tax records.

keyFacts: The document is a letter of authorization for duplicate tax records.
Alan Blecher is identified as an interested party in the tax records.
Ghislaine Maxwell is also mentioned as an interested party.
The document discusses the rights of parties regarding tax account information.
There are references to the process of obtaining tax records and the conditions under which they can be shared.
